Technique: FORMED BY HAND; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Greek ostracon
Description: This Greek ostracon, which was purchased by J. Capart at Luxor in 1900, contains a certificate of dyke corvee. It dates from the 15th April in the year 74 of our time, that is to say the reign of the emperor Vespasian.
